headline.print_headline: Retiree Awarded $15.6 Million in a Reported Ponzi Scheme Tied to MetLife
headline.main: Retiree Awarded $15.6 Million in Reported Ponzi Scheme Tied to MetLife

snippet: After an eight-week trial, a Los Angeles jury awarded the retiree, Christine Ramirez, punitive and compensatory damages....
abstract: Los Angeles jury orders MetLife, two of its subsidiaries and former managing partner to pay plaintiff Christine Ramirez $15.6 million in punitive and compensatory damages; Ramirez says company's insurance agent urged her to invest $280,000 into what turned out to be a Ponzi scheme; firm was found guilty on four civil counts including aiding and abetting violation of California securities laws, and is facing similar lawsuits.
